docs.snippet: In a story Aug. 14 about the National Guard arriving on the Texas border, The Associated Press, relying on information from the Texas National Guard, reported erroneously that the deployments were part of the 1,000 troops ordered by Gov. Rick Perr...
docs.lead_paragraph: In a story Aug. 14 about the National Guard arriving on the Texas border, The Associated Press, relying on information from the Texas National Guard, reported erroneously that the deployments were part of the 1,000 troops ordered by Gov. Rick Perry. Texas National Guard Master Sgt. Ken Walker said the troops, which are part of a counterdrug task force, do not count toward Perry's "Operation Strong Safety."

docs.snippet: Ford is recalling 83,250 vehicles because a faulty part could cause them to lose power or roll away if they're parked....
docs.lead_paragraph: Ford is recalling 83,250 vehicles because a faulty part could cause them to lose power or roll away if they're parked.

headline.sub: Thousands of Israelis rally in support of Gaza offensive
headline.main: Thousands of Israelis rally in support of Gaza offensive

docs.snippet: Thousands of Israelis gather in Tel Aviv's Rabin Square to rally in support of residents of southern Israel, a region frequently targeted by militants firing rockets from Gaza. Vanessa Johnston reports....
docs.lead_paragraph: Thousands of Israelis gather in Tel Aviv's Rabin Square to rally in support of residents of southern Israel, a region frequently targeted by militants firing rockets from Gaza. Vanessa Johnston reports.

headline.print_headline: Pershing Square Sues U.S. Over Fannie Mae, Freddie Mac
headline.main: Pershing Square Sues U.S. Over Fannie Mae, Freddie Mac

docs.snippet: Pershing Square Capital Management LP, the hedge fund firm run by William Ackman, has sued the U.S. government, claiming that its stripping of Fannie Mae's and Freddie Mac's profit illegally short changes investors in the mortgage companies' commo...
docs.lead_paragraph: Pershing Square Capital Management LP, the hedge fund firm run by William Ackman, has sued the U.S. government, claiming that its stripping of Fannie Mae's and Freddie Mac's profit illegally short changes investors in the mortgage companies' common stock.

headline.print_headline: Some Polygamous Families Face Eviction Over Fees
headline.main: Some Polygamous Families Face Eviction Over Fees

docs.snippet: Fourteen families who live in a community once controlled by polygamous sect leader Warren Jeffs could be evicted from their homes on the Utah-Arizona border in the coming weeks if they don't begin paying a $100-a-month fee to authorities appointe...
docs.lead_paragraph: Fourteen families who live in a community once controlled by polygamous sect leader Warren Jeffs could be evicted from their homes on the Utah-Arizona border in the coming weeks if they don't begin paying a $100-a-month fee to authorities appointed to oversee their property.

docs.lead_paragraph: A huge crowd of people protesting the death of a black Missouri teenager shot by a white police officer have gathered in Ferguson, chanting and carrying signs.

headline.print_headline: Loan Payment Delayed for Puerto Rico Power Company
headline.main: Loan Payment Delayed for Puerto Rico Power Company

docs.snippet: Puerto Rico's financially struggling public power company won a big reprieve Thursday, announcing that creditors agreed to postpone payment of $671 million worth of bank loans until next year....
docs.lead_paragraph: Puerto Rico's financially struggling public power company won a big reprieve Thursday, announcing that creditors agreed to postpone payment of $671 million worth of bank loans until next year.

headline.print_headline: Yemen's AQAP Calls on Islamists to Target America After Iraq Air Strikes
headline.main: Yemen's AQAP Calls on Islamists to Target America After Iraq Air Strikes

docs.snippet: Al Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula, one of the group's deadliest franchises, called on Islamists to target the United States, after Washington launched air strikes in Iraq against Islamist militants who operate as the Islamic State....
docs.lead_paragraph: Al Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula, one of the group's deadliest franchises, called on Islamists to target the United States, after Washington launched air strikes in Iraq against Islamist militants who operate as the Islamic State.

headline.print_headline: Missouri Protests Call Attention to Police 'Militarization'
headline.main: Missouri Protests Call Attention to Police 'Militarization'

docs.snippet: A U.S. military program that sends armored cars, camouflage and other battlefield equipment to police departments is under fresh scrutiny as demonstrators in Ferguson, Missouri, enter their fifth straight night of protests over the death of an una...
docs.lead_paragraph: A U.S. military program that sends armored cars, camouflage and other battlefield equipment to police departments is under fresh scrutiny as demonstrators in Ferguson, Missouri, enter their fifth straight night of protests over the death of an unarmed black teenager.
